commit_message:
XenAPI: Add support for vGPU

Please note: this is still work in progress and we will submit a
             spec for Mitaka. The purpose of this review is to
             serve as a proof of concept only.

It will implement the following functions to support vGPU
1. Add function to query the vGPU information from the host and
   save to the compute resource data structure;
2. Specify an extra_spec capabilities:vgpu:<vgpu model name> in
   the instance flavor, which tells nova-scheduler to filter
   out hosts which should have capability to support the specified
   vgpu model;
3. If vGPU is specified in extra_spec, the nova-scheduler will
   only return the hosts which have the requested vGPU resource.
4. When create VM, it will make a vGPU and attach it to the VM.

Change-Id: I38f304fa71807c05937eb642e1f04efe0df6aee2

commit_message:
XenAPI: Add spec to support Virtual GPU (VGPU)

Add the function in xenapi to support Virtual GPU (VGPU) in VMs which
run on the hosts which have the capacity of Virtual GPU.

Change-Id: Ide1f2626987c5fa57fec9d3c97ed238dd7e399a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 01:57:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix default RBAC policy quota

The previous config value for the default RBAC policy
was not in neutron.conf and value that was registered
as a config option 'rbac_entry' didn't match the resource
name 'rbac_policy' so the default did not take effect.

This patch corrects it by registering the 'rbac_policy'
option instead of 'rbac_entry' and documents it in neutron.conf.
It also adds an API test that exercises the quota limit and
ensures that it's not set to -1.

Change-Id: I8c8d4bcfda808e376af94048fe5a98c68a2a975f
Closes-Bug: #1522224

commit_message:
Fix default RBAC policy quota

The previous config value for the default RBAC policy
was not in neutron.conf and value that was registered
as a config option 'rbac_entry' didn't match the resource
name 'rbac_policy' so the default did not take effect.

This patch corrects it by registering the 'rbac_policy'
option instead of 'rbac_entry' and documents it in neutron.conf.
It also adds an API test that exercises the quota limit and
ensures that it's not set to -1.

Change-Id: I8c8d4bcfda808e376af94048fe5a98c68a2a975f
Closes-Bug: #1522224

Drop root for cinder

Updates to ensure commands run in the cinder containers
are done as the 'cinder' user rather than root.

Allow multiple imports for both ways of doing i18n

Disallowing the old way makes the transition period messier than
it needs to be.

[policy] Clarify bug deputy does not require core bit

Some small changes - since the original paragraph didn't mention that
core is not required until the very last sentence.

Change-Id: I113371933754c109247c5f2b789cda135dce8563

subject: Trivial: Improve doc for "server create" command
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 03:56:04.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Trivial: Improve doc for "server create" command

The following options of "server create" command support searching
by both name and ID. So add this info into doc.

--image, --volume, --flavor, --security.

Change-Id: I93b167da58144e5de6c9996009b7ea2449fb4cd8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Trivial: Improve doc for "server create" command

The following options of "server create" command support searching
by both name and ID. So add this info into doc.

--image, --volume, --flavor, --security.

Change-Id: I93b167da58144e5de6c9996009b7ea2449fb4cd8

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14885, 'name': 'Daniel Mellado', 'email': 'dmellado@redhat.com', 'username': 'daniel-mellado'}, {'_account_id': 16523, 'name': 'ZhangLei', 'display_name': 'ZhangLei', 'email': 'zhang.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'zhang.lei'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 01:42:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add the base microversions test part

This is base part of microversions tests.
This patch adds the mechanism for selecting the microversion tests based
on new configration options like the following:

TestClass A: min_microversion = None,  max_microversion = 'latest'
TestClass B: min_microversion = None,  max_microversion = '2.2'
TestClass C: min_microversion = '2.3', max_microversion = 'latest'
TestClass D: min_microversion = '2.5', max_microversion = '2.10'

 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
 | Configration       | Test classes                                     |
 | (min,    max)      | (Passed microversion)                            |
 +====================+==================================================+
 | None,     None     | A(Not passed), B(Not passed)                     |
 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
 | None,     '2.3'    | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C('2.3')           |
 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
 | '2.2',    'latest' | A('2.2'), B('2.2'), C('2.3'), D('2.5')           |
 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
 | '2.2',    '2.3'    | A('2.2'), B('2.2'), C('2.3')                     |
 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
 | '2.10',   '2.10'   | A('2.10'), C('2.10'), D('2.10')                  |
 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
 | None,     'latest' | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C('2.3'), D('2.5') |
 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+
 | 'latest', 'latest' | A('latest'), C('latest')                         |
 +--------------------+--------------------------------------------------+

After this patch, we need to add tests for each microversion and
these test classes need to contain the range of microversions.

Partially implements blueprint nova-microversions-tests

Change-Id: I57b78b4c0543b6fb0533b556886a19a03297555e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-11 07:08:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add the base microversions test part

on new configration options like the following:

TestClass A: min_microversion = None,  max_microversion = 'latest'
TestClass B: min_microversion = None,  max_microversion = '2.2'
TestClass C: min_microversion = '2.3', max_microversion = 'latest'
TestClass D: min_microversion = '2.5', max_microversion = '2.10'

  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | Configration       | Test classes                                        |
  | (min,    max)      | (Passed microversion)                               |
  +====================+=====================================================+
  | None,     None     | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C & D - Skipped       |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | None,     '2.3'    | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C('2.3'), D - Skipped |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | '2.2',    'latest' | A('2.2'), B('2.2'), C('2.3'), D('2.5')              |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | '2.2',    '2.3'    | A('2.2'), B('2.2'), C('2.3'), D - Skipped           |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | '2.10',   '2.10'   | A('2.10'), B - Skipped, C('2.10'), D('2.10')        |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | None,     'latest' | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C('2.3'), D('2.5')    |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | 'latest', 'latest' | A('latest'), B - Skipped, C('latest'), D - Skipped  |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+

After this patch, we need to add tests for each microversion and
these test classes need to contain the range of microversions.

Partially implements blueprint nova-microversions-tests

commit_message:
Add the base microversions test part

This is base part of microversions tests.
This patch adds the mechanism for selecting the microversion tests based
on new configration options like the following:

TestClass A: min_microversion = None,  max_microversion = 'latest'
TestClass B: min_microversion = None,  max_microversion = '2.2'
TestClass C: min_microversion = '2.3', max_microversion = 'latest'
TestClass D: min_microversion = '2.5', max_microversion = '2.10'

  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | Configration       | Test classes                                        |
  | (min,    max)      | (Passed microversion)                               |
  +====================+=====================================================+
  | None,     None     | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C & D - Skipped       |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | None,     '2.3'    | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C('2.3'), D - Skipped |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | '2.2',    'latest' | A('2.2'), B('2.2'), C('2.3'), D('2.5')              |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | '2.2',    '2.3'    | A('2.2'), B('2.2'), C('2.3'), D - Skipped           |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | '2.10',   '2.10'   | A('2.10'), B - Skipped, C('2.10'), D('2.10')        |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | None,     'latest' | A(Not passed), B(Not passed), C('2.3'), D('2.5')    |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+
  | 'latest', 'latest' | A('latest'), B - Skipped, C('latest'), D - Skipped  |
  +--------------------+-----------------------------------------------------+

After this patch, we need to add tests for each microversion and
these test classes need to contain the range of microversions.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions-testing-support

Change-Id: I57b78b4c0543b6fb0533b556886a19a03297555e

Add functional/check tests for osa-security

This patch simplifies the testing setup for openstack-ansible-security and
adds in testing for check mode and functional Ansible runs.

In benchmarks, simplejson is notably faster (especially for encoding)
than the built in json module for Python. Since it was always possible

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Always use simplejson

In benchmarks, simplejson is notably faster (especially for encoding)
than the built in json module for Python. Since it was always possible
to be in use in python 2.6, this should be a relatively safe change, as
it hasn't been that long that the projects haven't been tested with 2.6.

Change-Id: I13c363cad3d11427ebed622455d778cca4103ff2

Use subprocess.check_output instead of Popen

Now that py26 support has been dropped check_output can be used.

Partial-Bug: 1519449

zuul: enable integration jobs for puppet-aodh

commit_message:
Add release notes for changes since 3.0.0 release

We decided to use reno for coming releases, but we don't
have entries for changes made after the previous release
was shipped. This commit adds notes for them.

Also fixes the wrong place of "Release Notes" section in
the document index. It was my mistake in the past commit.

Change-Id: Ie0eedf8cb82a57db070a65f73d965f1a3ce378ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 19:23:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Run NOT NULL alterations before foreign key adds

The "migrate resources table" migration will fail
for some MariaDB versions if the NOT NULL alteration
is applied after the foreign key constraint has been
added [1].   This patch reverses the order so that
NOT NULL is applied first.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/480820/

Change-Id: Iab2b9fc7d82c739ae458ee48c1830541fb0f9579
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-03 19:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/mitaka/contract/8a6d8bdae39_migrate_neutron_resources_table.py'], 'message': 'Run NOT NULL alterations before foreign key adds

The "migrate resources table" migration will fail
for some MariaDB versions if the NOT NULL alteration
is applied after the foreign key constraint has been
added [1].   This patch reverses the order so that
NOT NULL is applied first.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/480820/

Change-Id: Iab2b9fc7d82c739ae458ee48c1830541fb0f9579
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Run NOT NULL alterations before foreign key adds

The "migrate resources table" migration will fail
for some MariaDB versions if the NOT NULL alteration
is applied after the foreign key constraint has been
added [1].   This patch reverses the order so that
NOT NULL is applied first.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/480820/

Change-Id: Iab2b9fc7d82c739ae458ee48c1830541fb0f9579

commit_message:
Step 3 of module rename

In this step all of the imports and usage of akanda.rug is updated to
use astara. Addtionally rename all internal references from Akanda to
Astara.

Change-Id: I0cb8596066d949bceaadc4718b210fc373b5f296
Depends-On: I87106ae63747291bb6424839b5155f53136c54f9
Implements: blueprint convert-to-astara

commit_message:
Add a script to create review dashboard for a milestone

This script queries launchpad to get:
1) Bug number of bugs tagged with rfe-approved
2) Bug number of critical/high bugs
3) list of blueprints targeted for the milestone passed as param

With this information the scripts prints queries that can be used
in Gerrit directly and creates a .dash file that can be used by
gerrit-dash-creator to output a dashboard url.

Change-Id: I09f8c04c6c609d4791bd5af825105ba092831e43

commit_message:
turn neutron notifications off by default

unless something (ceilometer) is going to consume the notification
messages, we should turn notifications off.  This commit follows the
same pattern that the other roles use for enabling/disabling
notifications.

Bug: #1522042
Change-Id: If6d4f0fd1c441a6bd8dc48f6bea8a4906a9d96b2
(cherry picked from commit f8f108f09dfff212ae175bdec2dd8a363a165318)

subject: Add container-reconciler and object-expirer to os-swift
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-01 09:01:39.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_swift/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/tasks/swift_storage_hosts_object.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/object-server-replicator.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/container-server-replicator.conf.j2', 'etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml.example', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/account-server-replicator.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/container-reconciler.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/tasks/swift_storage_hosts_container.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/object-expirer.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/container-server.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/object-server.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/account-server.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Add container-reconciler and object-expirer to os-swift

The container-reconciler and object-expirer were missing from the os-swift
role. The reconciler  makes sure incorrectly placed objets live in the
correct storage policy. The expirer is the service that deletes expired objects.

This change also adds the abilty to optionally specify a reclaim_age in the swift
section of the configuration, which is now set in all the locations required,
still with the default of 604800 seconds (7 days).

Change-Id: Ic56a714c3fb3c84b9bb5ed8e2ae3c86dad474161
Closes-Bug: #1516877
(cherry picked from commit b8fa505969c1ad7d38a83d6d87c9891326e20622)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add container-reconciler and object-expirer to os-swift

The container-reconciler and object-expirer were missing from the os-swift
role. The reconciler  makes sure incorrectly placed objets live in the
correct storage policy. The expirer is the service that deletes expired objects.

This change also adds the abilty to optionally specify a reclaim_age in the swift
section of the configuration, which is now set in all the locations required,
still with the default of 604800 seconds (7 days).

Change-Id: Ic56a714c3fb3c84b9bb5ed8e2ae3c86dad474161
Closes-Bug: #1516877
(cherry picked from commit b8fa505969c1ad7d38a83d6d87c9891326e20622)

commit_message:
Ensure the Linux Bridge agent can be used with provider networking

The root cause is that when provider network is used, devstack
is trying to build ovs related interface.

We need to make a condition such that if linux bridge is used, don't
build any ovs related interface.

Change-Id: I7f26ce7893a0ecce55b3467cd5621abf25745b8e
Closes-bug: #1509705

commit_message:
Update compression license check

lslicense is not used for V9000 compression check.
compression_enclosures and compression_capacity are
always 0 for V9000. V9000 uses license_scheme 9846
as an indicator.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I62096af1c47b233a6e05ee7916a75b68167bfd28
Closes-Bug: 1514801

commit_message:
Insert "tenant_id" into os-simple-tenant-usage-v2.1

This commit fixes the following URIs:

  * GET /v2.1/os-simple-tenant-usage
    -> GET /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-simple-tenant-usage

  * GET /v2.1/os-simple-tenant-usage/{tenant_id}
    -> GET /v2.1/{tenant_id}/os-simple-tenant-usage/{tenant_id}

Change-Id: I3429cb2f6497178c9e04a60d5698da97b19bd1c6
Closes-Bug: #1519558

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-14 11:40:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'rbd cannot delete residual image from ceph in some situations

RBD supports a mechanism that when add image operation failed, rollback
operation must be triggered (delete residual image if it was created).

Base on a condition, uploading image through glance RESTful api failed,
the incomplete image has not been taken snapshot, so that unprotect
snap operation will throw exception "rbd.ImageNotFound".

This exception will be disposed finally, while the code relating to
remove residual image from ceph has been skipped.

Thus, re-uploading image will failed using the same image id due to above
reason (residual image already exists).

Change-Id: Ib5a0642350b62f8fdaec3569a3ccce6ac4b8a5fc
modified:   glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py
modified:   glance_store/tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-07-15 03:32:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'rbd driver cannot delete residual image from ceph in some cases

RBD supports a mechanism that when add image operation failed, rollback
operation will be triggered (delete residual image if it was created).

When uploading image through glance api failed, however, the incomplete
image has not been taken snapshot yet, then rollback operation do unprotect
snap will throw exception "rbd.ImageNotFound".

This exception will lead to the code relating to remove residual image
from ceph, which is the true purpose of rollback, has been skipped.

Thus, re-uploading image will failed using the same image id due to above
reason (residual image already exists) & residual image need to be deleted
manually from ceph.

Change-Id: Ib5a0642350b62f8fdaec3569a3ccce6ac4b8a5fc
modified:   glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py
modified:   glance_store/tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py

commit_message:
rbd driver cannot delete residual image from ceph in some cases

RBD supports a mechanism that when add image operation failed, rollback
operation will be triggered (delete residual image if it was created).

When uploading image through glance api failed, however, the incomplete
image has not been taken snapshot yet, then rollback operation do unprotect
snap will throw exception "rbd.ImageNotFound".

This exception will lead to the code relating to remove residual image
from ceph, which is the true purpose of rollback, has been skipped.

Thus, re-uploading image will failed using the same image id due to above
reason (residual image already exists) & residual image need to be deleted
manually from ceph.

Closes-Bug: #1473953

Change-Id: Ib5a0642350b62f8fdaec3569a3ccce6ac4b8a5fc
modified:   glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py
modified:   glance_store/exceptions.py
modified:   glance_store/tests/unit/test_rbd_store.py

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-27 10:46:55.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/client.py'], 'message': 'Unicode fix in BaseClient._do_request() on py3

The exception message is read from the request body. On Python 3, the
HTTP body is a bytes string, whereas an exception message must be
text. Decode the HTTP body from UTF-8 to get the message as text.

Change-Id: I0d434b04db78b2319b723e5968effdde766368c9
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unicode fix in BaseClient._do_request() on py3

The exception message is read from the request body. On Python 3, the
HTTP body is a bytes string, whereas an exception message must be
text. Decode the HTTP body from UTF-8 to get the message as text.

Change-Id: I0d434b04db78b2319b723e5968effdde766368c9

commit_message:
Fix errors showing in Network tests

A test refactor was a little incomplete, causing errors to be thrown
during the test run. This patch fixes the test helper causing the
issues, and corrects the ordering of some of the message arguments.

Change-Id: I4dc992f1bd1f7b074519987e211a761b6575f8d9
Closes-Bug: 1522814

commit_message:
Cleanup use of service refs

Remove unnecessary copy() calls.
Remove unneeded duplication. No need to make new service refs when self.service is OK.
Catch a missed manually created ref.

Change-Id: Ie2d1f079de170847632ff605e91ee0a19ebffdc6

subject: Make sure that cloud always has a name
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 16:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py'], 'message': "Make sure that cloud always has a name

If we don't ask for a cloud, and we fall through to the envvars cloud or
the defaults cloud, the cloud that is returned winds up not being named
- even though we know what cloud it is. Set the name of the cloud we're
working with.

This is important for the next patch, where we need to peek at the
config to get some default values, but in a fallthrough case we do not
know which cloud to request.

Change-Id: Ie56e490d4384f2d680450bc956e4b7b5b8099f0e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make sure that cloud always has a name

If we don't ask for a cloud, and we fall through to the envvars cloud or
the defaults cloud, the cloud that is returned winds up not being named
- even though we know what cloud it is. Set the name of the cloud we're
working with.

This is important for the next patch, where we need to peek at the
config to get some default values, but in a fallthrough case we do not
know which cloud to request.

Change-Id: Ie56e490d4384f2d680450bc956e4b7b5b8099f0e

commit_message:
Add support for secure.yaml file for auth info

Almost nothing in clouds.yaml is secret, but the file has to be treated
as if it were because of the passwords or other secrets contained in it.
This makes it difficult to put clouds.yaml into a public or broadly
accessible config repository. Add support for having a second optional
file, secure.yaml, which can contain any value you can put in
clouds.yaml and which will be overlayed on top of clouds.yaml values.

Most people probably do not need this, but for folks with complex cloud
configs with teams of people working on them, this reduces the amount of
things that have to be managed by the privileged system.

Change-Id: I631d826588b0a0b1f36244caa7982dd42d9eb498

commit_message:
Add scripts to run up Kafka messaging service

Kafka is needed to test kafka driver of oslo_messaging.
To use kafka service, users have to set `enable_service kafka`
in local.conf file.

Change-Id: I2fda73820a834c2ac8d16c1c4f64e78229bf31b0
Implements: blueprint adding-kafka-support

commit_message:
Cleanup region refs

Remove unnecessary copy() calls.
Remove unneeded "description=''" and "extras={}".
Use new_region_ref instead of manually creating a ref.

Change-Id: I7de0e313b46a4bd15bdec23e0993247064157141

commit_message:
Use unit.new_project_ref consistently

Replace all hand created project refs with calls to new_project_ref().
In unit tests, rename 'tenant' variables to 'project' where appropriate.

Bump Keystoneauth minimum

Bump the keystoneauth1 minimum so that we can rely on the new argparse
functionality in the consuming libraries (clients, occ, etc).

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 20:15:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[fix-compat] Tolerate non-string defaults in String type

Cinder folks found an issue where StrOpt had a default
value set to an integer. We were tolerating this before
so we should continue to do so with a warning.

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-04 22:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_generator.py', 'oslo_config/types.py'], 'message': '[fix-compat] Tolerate non-string defaults in String type

commit_message:
[fix-compat] Tolerate non-string defaults in String type

Cinder folks found an issue where StrOpt had a default
value set to an integer. We were tolerating this before
so we should continue to do so with a warning.

Change-Id: I0af75f1a7102454d9285ab8df9d19242fada2325

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-11-28 22:20:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "HyperV: remove driver from the neutron tree

The hyperv drivers and code should be part of the networking-hyperv
project (https://github.com/openstack/networking-hyperv).

A few changes are necessary in order to prevent Hyper-V deployments from
breaking, especially when upgrading to Mitaka.

First of all, instead of the current Hyper-V mechanism_driver, the
networking_hyperv equivalent must be used.
Secondly, Hyper-V deployments are configured to use the in-branch
HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver. Removing it will cause the Hyper-V
Neutron Agent to fail. If the agent is configured to use the old driver, the
networking_hyperv's driver must be used instead and the users must be warned to
update their configuration files to use the networking_hyperv's security groups
driver.

Removes the neutron-hyperv-agent entry point from setup.cfg.
Replaces the Hyper-V mechanism_driver in setup.cfg with the
networking_hyperv equivalent.
Removes neutron.plugins.hyperv.agent.security_groups_driver.HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver.
Adds map between old firewall drivers and their replacement in securitygroups_rpc.
Adds logic that detects misconfigured firewall_drivers, logs a warning and replaces
them with proper drivers.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Depends-On: I3a25f18b4f3a0621cb92b44eb61e434fa87e0aab

Change-Id: I32451cba6933e88306a4308a07f3f0d1b81f626c
Closes-bug: #1520054

commit_message:
Hyper-V: remove driver from the neutron tree

The hyperv drivers and code should be part of the networking-hyperv
project (https://github.com/openstack/networking-hyperv).

A few changes are necessary in order to prevent Hyper-V deployments from
breaking, especially when upgrading to Mitaka.

Hyper-V deployments are configured to use the in-branch HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver.
Removing it will cause the Hyper-V Neutron Agent to fail. If the agent is
configured to use the old driver, the networking_hyperv's driver must be used
instead and the users must be warned to update their configuration files to
use the networking_hyperv's security groups driver.

Removes the neutron-hyperv-agent entry point from setup.cfg.
Removes the hyperv mechanism_driver from setup.cfg
Moves the in-tree HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver to the networking_hyperv equivalent.
Logs a warning if the in-tree HyperVSecurityGroupsDriver is used.
Removes pywin32 and wmi requirements, as they've been included in networking_hyperv
and they are Hyper-V specific requirements.
Adds release note regarding the deprecated security groups driver.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Depends-On: I3a25f18b4f3a0621cb92b44eb61e434fa87e0aab

Change-Id: I32451cba6933e88306a4308a07f3f0d1b81f626c
Closes-bug: #1520054

commit_message:
Fix api_server agent test that broke due to a dep change

The test was slightly incorrect to begin with, but the issue didn't
become apparent until the oslo.log update from 1.13.0 to 2.0.0 for
whatever reason. open() raises IOError() not Exception() so it was not
being handled properly.

Also taking this opportunity to standardize the use of builtins to
match our other tests.

(cherry picked from commit Idab637b09e8a437333f810f82f45b3e9c027dfdd)

Change-Id: Iddafa6636777aac83e9e5b030466ded46170c52c

commit_message:
Enable vhost-user ports on supported platforms.

Over the past six months ovs and odl have been extended to report
the supported port types available on the vswitch.
This change extends the bind_port implementation to consult the supported
port types of the vswitch on the selected compute host when selecting the
VIF_TYPE to bind.

Change-Id: Ib97c2d2e1e2e1cd536bc27ac54a8f27a5963e883
Closes-Bug: #1477611
Depends-On: I78cac4f5b9de381ebb7c5a97a34f60ebe6e56ba3

commit_message:
Extract loadbalancer_id from listener create events

We're currently dropping the lb id from listener events, causing
a cache lookup that ends up hitting deleted loadbalancers instead
of the intended one.  This fixes it and looks for loadbalancer_id
in the correct place of listener create events body.

Closes-bug: #1509595
(cherry picked from commit 1ef5c523e98eaf8d90184083d8f4af4f2619b527)

Change-Id: I541a2132d66cb0c737fd25452afd87950828ea43

subject: Fix Resource.__eq__ mismatch semantics of object equal
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-28 10:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/unit/test_base.py', 'glanceclient/openstack/common/apiclient/base.py'], 'message': "Fix Resource.__eq__ mismatch semantics of object equal

The __eq__ of apiclient.base.Resource will return True,
if the two objects have same id, even if they have different
other attributes value. The behavior is weird and don't
match the semantics of object equal. The objects that have
different value should be different objects.
Fix this issue and add some test cases in this patch.

Change-Id: I24ba39bf90d727116f256de46241746520efbfee
Closes-Bug: #1499369
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix Resource.__eq__ mismatch semantics of object equal

The __eq__ of apiclient.base.Resource will return True,
if the two objects have same id, even if they have different
other attributes value. The behavior is weird and don't
match the semantics of object equal. The objects that have
different value should be different objects.
Fix this issue and add some test cases in this patch.

Change-Id: I24ba39bf90d727116f256de46241746520efbfee
Closes-Bug: #1499369

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-21 05:49:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix error handling in nova.cmd.baseproxy

If an error occurs in nova.cmd.baseproxy the method exit_with_error
will be executed that looks as follows:

def exit_with_error(msg, errno=-1):
	print(msg) and sys.exit(errno)

However, in python2.7 this method terminates the application without
printing anything(unable to flush on time) and in Python3.4 it does
strange things because print() returns None.

This commit add code to flush the buffered data before sys.exit calls.

Change-Id: I519b68f8c2bc62988de87bdd2847d5f3be7e532d
Closes-Bug: #1506213
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-22 01:21:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_baseproxy.py', 'nova/cmd/baseproxy.py'], 'message': 'Fix error handling in nova.cmd.baseproxy

If an error occurs in nova.cmd.baseproxy the method exit_with_error
will be executed that looks as follows:

def exit_with_error(msg, errno=-1):
	print(msg) and sys.exit(errno)

However, in python2.7 this method terminates the application without
printing anything(unable to flush on time) and in Python3.4 it does
strange things because print() returns None.

This commit modifies exit_with_error method to output error message
with stderr(which in unbuffered).

Change-Id: I519b68f8c2bc62988de87bdd2847d5f3be7e532d
Closes-Bug: #1506213
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix error handling in nova.cmd.baseproxy

If an error occurs in nova.cmd.baseproxy the method exit_with_error
will be executed that looks as follows:

def exit_with_error(msg, errno=-1):
	print(msg) and sys.exit(errno)

However, in python2.7 this method terminates the application without
printing anything(unable to flush on time) and in Python3.4 it does
strange things because print() returns None.

This commit modifies exit_with_error method to output error message
with stderr(which in unbuffered).

Change-Id: I519b68f8c2bc62988de87bdd2847d5f3be7e532d
Closes-Bug: #1506213

commit_message:
Avoid the dual-naming confusion

The module 'driver' is an import and it is also a variable name,
this can be confusing so rename it to be named differently.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie45dd6901afdd7083a75adf75f73e99bfe304ab5

commit_message:
Enables py3 unit tests for libvirt.host module

Python 3  '/' returns a float, while '//' returns an int.

Removes unit tests from tests-py3.txt blacklist.

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: I87338aac1871a63dc17f1b81a7870d8911f3a399

subject: Elasticsearch v2 client warning causes devstack to not stack
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 21:21:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Elasticsearch v2 client warning causes devstack to not stack

We added a warning message about the v2 ES client not working
with searchlight. This works fine, but a complete devstack
run wasn't tested. When I just stacked, it couldn't complete
because of using sys.exit(1) when the warning is emitted.
This changes it to (0) so that devstack will, well, err...
stack.

Once global requirements and searchlight requirements
are capped at v2, the exit code of 1 will be more appropriate.

Change-Id: I92bde9826ef789c390b4abc791cb384aef4d422b
Partial-Bug: #253177
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-04 22:33:04.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Elasticsearch v2 client warning causes devstack to not stack

We added a warning message about the v2 ES client not working
with searchlight. This works fine, but a complete devstack
run wasn't tested. When I just stacked, it couldn't complete
because of using sys.exit(1) when the warning is emitted.
This changes it to (0) so that devstack will, well, err...
stack.

Once global requirements and searchlight requirements
are capped at v2, the exit code of 1 will be more appropriate.

Change-Id: I92bde9826ef789c390b4abc791cb384aef4d422b
Partial-Bug: #253177
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Elasticsearch v2 client warning causes devstack to not stack

We added a warning message about the v2 ES client not working
with searchlight. This works fine, but a complete devstack
run wasn't tested. When I just stacked, it couldn't complete
because of using sys.exit(1) when the warning is emitted.
This changes it to (0) so that devstack will, well, err...
stack.

Once global requirements and searchlight requirements
are capped at v2, the exit code of 1 will be more appropriate.

Change-Id: I92bde9826ef789c390b4abc791cb384aef4d422b
Partial-Bug: #253177

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-28 14:26:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ajax errors should return correctly.

Currently, any ajax call that hits an error other than NotAuthorized or
NotAuthenticated the end-response returned will likely be a 500 error
with all the html of our ISE page included.

Richard Jones's API code already provides a way to handle these issues,
so we should use that!

Change-Id: I53a65d6590c6005dff96d583b2c55a0653b2b1c9
Closes-Bug: #1489905
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-04 19:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/rest/utils.py', 'horizon/middleware.py'], 'message': "Ajax errors should return correctly.

Currently, any ajax call that hits an error other than NotAuthorized or
NotAuthenticated the end-response returned will likely be a 500 error
with all the html of our ISE page included.

Richard Jones's API code already provides a way to handle these issues,
so we should use that!

Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>

commit_message:
Ajax errors should return correctly.

Currently, any ajax call that hits an error other than NotAuthorized or
NotAuthenticated the end-response returned will likely be a 500 error
with all the html of our ISE page included.

Richard Jones's API code already provides a way to handle these issues,
so we should use that!

Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>

Change-Id: I53a65d6590c6005dff96d583b2c55a0653b2b1c9
Closes-Bug: #1489905

commit_message:
Remove 'MANIFEST.in'

Everything in this file is automatically generated by pbr. There
appears to be no good reason to keep it around.
More details please see:
https://github.com/openstack-dev/pbr/blob/master/pbr/packaging.py#L384

Change-Id: I0b802106c9b1fe95840de3605042c45330627486

commit_message:
Additional inspection role and adding role to NV job script

Addition of an inspection role, the appropriate test and enrollment
playbooks, and an entry for the node inspection to take place as
part of the long running non-voting job for initial testing.

Implements: blueprint bifrost-inspector-support
Depends-On: I4ba3f0cf4ad6f5466e52f5d034bb217f06eec7dd
Change-Id: Iceaf96aaeedc99530fabe2af47bab414d689c3dd

commit_message:
Avoid Pool object creating in pool_member functional calls

This patch revises pool_member related function calls to invoke
get_id method to get target pool ID. This change avoids Pool
object creating which is unnecessary.

Change-Id: Ie1150040b9178f5b18ca1de6ab141478f73140cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 22:53:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add authorize method to Connection

The ability to know your application is going to fail due to a
credential issue *before* getting into the application and attempting to
make some API call can be useful. This change adds Connection.authorize,
which just does the same thing we do implicitly. It's entirely optional
and is documented as such.

Change-Id: If86f308da909c4ff31f37294a000c6972c947182
Closes-Bug: #1513200

commit_message:
Add authorize method to Connection

The ability to know your application is going to fail due to a
credential issue *before* getting into the application and attempting to
make some API call can be useful. This change adds Connection.authorize,
which just does the same thing we do implicitly. It's entirely optional
and is documented as such.

Co-Authored-By: Qiming Teng (tengqim@cn.ibm.com)
Closes-Bug: #1513200
Change-Id: If86f308da909c4ff31f37294a000c6972c947182

commit_message:
[fix-compat] Support older use case for Opt type

In I7cf94a1b2cbbfe67282e8a157548caff825d2811, we we moved
type formatting from generator to type, however we still have
some older code/libraries that were using a Opt with a type
set to a string. We need to support them until we find and
fix all use cases. So we explicitly check if format_defaults
is present and call it if it is. If format_defaults is
not present we call the older code from the change id
mentioned above.

Closes-Bug: #1522637
Change-Id: I298e75afbd43bd35aba93c38129008789ed39146

commit_message:
Creating nova-secret with safe file permissions

This fix will make sure that the nova-secret file will
be created with save "0600" (r--) permissions.

Additionally a new task will make sure that the file is removed
from the filesystem. This will minimize any unprivileged exposure
to the nova-secret file content.

Change-Id: I1c3ec322b2a661cf7dce0334866c90201bbef0a0
Closes-Bug: #1519088
(cherry picked from commit eca0f5ddfba5ac12fc0199d854b3f18504f9ccd3)

commit_message:
Remove low-level PyKMIP test asserts

This change removes two low-level asserts that test the internals of
PyKMIP core. The referenced portions of PyKMIP have been modified in the
latest release. Once the latest release has been published, these asserts
will be added back in, modified to work properly with the new version of
PyKMIP.

Partial-Bug: #1522856
Change-Id: I50b9a4ad935d6458c5dc42f8184a724c78a28a59

Add CLI option guideline

A lot of changes have been proposed to add options to
*-create/update operations. This guideline tries to clarify
the conventions used in neutornclient.

commit_message:
Remove Neutron core static example configuration files

Oslo config generator was introduced in patch [1] to
automatically generate the sample Neutron core configuration
files.

This patch removes the static example configuration files from
the repository as they are now redundant.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/204206/

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic7ae2e038b5bd7b215c65c9c565bfe31ef551520
Partially-Implements: blueprint autogen-neutron-conf-file
Closes-bug: #1199963
Depends-On: Ic37a16b6cf8eb92030649f1fc8b198738a8cc104

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/080694.html

Change-Id: I817f1a7331b8664486544c82e1a9a917864601bf
Closes-Bug: #1520096

commit_message:
Do not include reno releasenotes in normal documentation

Per the recent release note guidelines for libraries [1],
reno based release notes will be moved out from the normal docs.
The previous (partial) release notes are also moved to
releasenotes directory. The developer documentation now
has a link to the releasenote web site.

In addition, having reno directive in normal sphinx document
prevents users from generating our docs from release tarballs.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/080694.html

Change-Id: I817f1a7331b8664486544c82e1a9a917864601bf
Closes-Bug: #1520096

commit_message:
Domain Specific Roles

This spec outlines support for domain specific roles that can be
used with the implied roles functionality to allow a domain
administrator to better model their role usage.

Implements: blueprint domain-specific-roles

Change-Id: I2aa390edca32734857e5f3cc8decacf4072e697a

commit_message:
Disable CentOS6 nodes in nodepool

We now have no more jobs using CentOS6, so disable them in nodepool.

-1 is magic value for: Do not even build new images.

Change-Id: I573a2709389c66780a822325b882609e853b8b84

commit_message:
Don't drop uri path when selecting glance api

Do not drop the glance URI path when selecting the glance api server.

urlparse.urlparse splits out the path from the host/port/etc and we
previously just dropped the path on the floor. This means that it is
impossible from Nova's perspective to have glance located anywhere but
the root of the server/vhost/etc that glance is acting on.

Closes-Bug #1520937

Change-Id: Ib037ef20b6f3a803ca597f1571c66c7373af3dbf

commit_message:
Remove unused glance function and tests

As part of the effort to discover the glance endpoint via the service
catalog, this removes unused code from the glance file. This change
is to ensure that we are not keeping code around that could produce
the wrong values.

Change-Id: Id3cff0f0a86952860c1d4b7f3670bd0c786b7066
Related-Bug: #1520937
Partial-Bug: #1084138

commit_message:
Added to ability to set mtu for lxcbr0

The lxc_host role overrides the configuration
done by the system administrator on the host.

If mtu was defined in /etc/lxc/ and in the
system network interfaces, then these configurations
will be overriden.

This commit should allow the deployer to set the
mtu for its lxcbr0 network, by setting the variable
lxc_net_mtu.

Fixes-Bug: #1518303

(cherry-picked from I42ab3d0a2c20ae94335de195cdb14579d9f59f5f)

Change-Id: Ibdfe6f40199ecec764ca18b2155d37bf52cf2ba8

commit_message:
Fix nova_virt_type auto-detection

In https://review.openstack.org/243098 nova_virt_type auto-detection
was implemented, but the default nova_virt_type value of kvm was left
in place, resulting in the auto-detection never happening.

This patch implements the auto-detection if nova-virt_type is not set
and removes the default value for nova-virt_type.

Change-Id: Ic1c8f042bc6bbee542373d335f338866efa06dc7

commit_message:
remove gate-devstack-dsvm-cells

gate-devstack-dsvm-cells was a stop gap job on juno/kilo to use
devstack exercises on cells until the tempest job got working. The
tempest job was working in kilo, and now votes.

With juno gone, and the old job almost testing nothing on kilo (it
boots 1 vm only), we should remove it and just leave the tempest-cells
job where it already is.

Change-Id: I829903b0690faea2d499f4ba8a2393cf31ed4601

commit_message:
Updated the py_pkgs lookup plugin for multi source

The py_pkgs lookup plugin will now handle multiple sources. This change
was needed to enable the system to allow for overrides of repo_package
resources and general python packaging as found throughout the stack.
The module has precedence as it loads / searches for packages and he item
loaded last is the one that has the most precedence.

The repo-build play has been updated to now search for compatible packages
in the main playbook directory, the root ansible role directory and the
user_variables file.

Documentation has been added regarding this capability and how to override
and set items to meet the needs of the deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1510575
Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Change-Id: Ib7cda14db18c0ca58bb5ac495d1c201812cf0f48
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2f35e36e54efb7b0e767d0888782f86696ef84b9)

commit_message:
Add sdist check to pep8 build script

Inability to create an sdist tarball is a fundamental problem, but
because of how we run tox in unittest builders, we often do not catch
this anymore. The potential harm is that a change can land to a project
that breaks the ability to create an sdist or run a direct setup.py
install or pip install . - which will in turn break the requirements
gate which tries to do those things.

Change-Id: Ibc36edb06cf072b9f0cf664fae3c3c2273ff71e6

commit_message:
[config-ref] Manila cleanup

Overall:
Follow our conventions for formatting and style.

EMC:
Remove mention that server needs to be restarted.

Generic:
Remove Juno and Liberty changes, this guide documents Mitaka.

HDFS:
Do not duplicate information about options that are in the table.

commit_message:
Fixes playbook runtime issues with ldap

When using an LDAP backend the plabooks fail when "ensuring.*"
which is a keystone client action. The reason for the failure is
related to how ldap backend, and is triggered when the service
users are within the ldap and not SQL. To resolve the issue a boolean
conditional was created on the various OS_.* roles to skip specific
tasks when the service users have already been added into LDAP.

Closes-Bug: #1518351
Closes-Bug: #1519174
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 283a89afa8d9d6840f77e902ad1127260f32a195)
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

Change-Id: I1727d896373cbcf667da779c8dd62145268eb8c2

commit_message:
Fix repr of a host from a hosts.list()

The os-hosts API uses different attribute names depending on
whether the host was returned as part of a list or not.
A host returned from 'show host' has the attribute "host"
whereas a host returned from 'list hosts' has the attribute
"host_name".

This adds a host_name property to the Host class that will set the
"host" attribute if necessary. Although this doesn't exactly mirror
the responses coming back from nova api, it will make it easier for
users to use the objects interchangeably for hosts.list() operations
and hosts.update() operations, for example.

Co-Authored-By: Chung Chih, Hung <lyan.h@inwinstack.com>

Closes-Bug: #1434167

Change-Id: I5c339bdd1ab867d972759ade9a10b86bfda1e70a

commit_message:
gnocchi: remove possible ending / in URL

If the URL ends up with a /, then URL are built with 2 /
e.g. POST //v1/foobar and that does not work.

Change-Id: I98e9a0e85e9dd6ae022bbc0543244e533b1307f7

commit_message:
create apt_get_update to try to work around broken mirrors

Ubuntu's apt mirroring mechanism produces inconsistent mirrors pretty
regularly. The devstack-gate apt-get update model seems to have been
more effective getting past this than what we did in devstack. Adopt
that method for our updates.

Change-Id: I97c7896ef38b275aacb4f933fc849acee1bab858

Remove hardcoded postgresql version and paths, because they broke
installation in CentOS7

Is compatible with CentOS6 master node

commit_message:
Emit warning if indexing with elasticsearch v2

If the v2 client is installed, emit a warning when attempting to index
without --no-delete (the default) instructing the user to consult the
documentation to manually delete the index and rerun with --no-delete.

This can be removed after global-requirements is capped (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/252075/) or once reindexing no longer
requires an in-place clearing of data.

Change-Id: I8ad3efb0addf6be516b0f8bbf18543b19175ac5d
Partial-Bug: #1515412

commit_message:
Update for akanda->astara rename

This updates astara-horizon code for the project rename:

* References to Akanda/akanda changed to Astara/astara
* Refernces to RUG/Rug removed or replaced with astara
* RugClient -> AstaraClient
* Panel renamed RUG -> Astara

Also added copyright headers to all code files.

Change-Id: I78eeacda4f8ae16a61890d9cbfd41ddf037b9677
Partially-implements: blueprint astara-horizon-mitaka

commit_message:
Fix incorrect task status with wrong parameter

Now, when use wrong parameter to create a import task, the task's
status will be processing forever. Actually the task has been stopped
and returned error.
So in this situation, the task's status should be changed into failure.

Closes-bug: #1495519
Change-Id: Ie4b3b92aaddcdbb839aadf61c75fc0c915e2040e

commit_message:
Fix metric-statistics doesn't respond "Bad Request"

When metric-statistics with end_time equals start_time received,
python monasca-api responds "200 OK" instead of "400 Bad Request".

Change-Id: I56cf42c2530be83b4555a05b4c433666a4ccdb5e
Closes-Bug: #1520029

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 15:01:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix bug where clean steps do not run

A bug was introduced during Liberty where Ironic transparently
ignores all clean steps and finishes cleaning. This is caused
by _get_node_next_clean_steps returning an empty list when
cleaning has just started. Fix this method to return the full
list of clean steps when cleaning begins.

This may leave previous tenants' data on disk and available to future
tenants. Deployers should apply this patch (or upgrade to a new release
with this patch) ASAP.

Change-Id: If815f81d7e668244f0d434d4e2933e8f41946107
Closes-Bug: #1517277

cleaning has just started. Fix this method to return the full
list of clean steps when cleaning begins.

This may leave previous tenants' data on disk and available to future

commit_message:
Fix bug where clean steps do not run

A bug was introduced during Liberty where Ironic transparently
ignores all clean steps and finishes cleaning. This is caused
by _get_node_next_clean_steps returning an empty list when
cleaning has just started. Fix this method to return the full
list of clean steps when cleaning begins.

This may leave previous tenants' data on disk and available to future
tenants. Deployers should apply this patch (or upgrade to a new release
with this patch) ASAP.

Depends-On: Id15cf6cc49122b08e557e44871b31a8c0d20b55d

Change-Id: If815f81d7e668244f0d434d4e2933e8f41946107
Closes-Bug: #1517277

commit_message:
MAINTAINERS: remove outdated data

This is outdated and never updated anyway. It does not reflect the reality
anymore, so let's stop trying to have that as it does not give any useful
information anyway. We're a team, we maintain everything!

(and we can use git log to find out things)

Change-Id: I3cd517a8f0565166c4ba33af08e68ebe1cbc7436

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2015-12-02 02:31:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Using oslo config CONF handle for registering barbican config options

The issue is around missing barbican configuration values when
its accessed via oslo_config.cfg.CONF handle which is the mechanism
used by few openstack common components.

To address this, using oslo_config.cfg.CONF instance as base config
and registering barbican specific config options on it. If some
other plugin registers its option later (initialized on-demand),
that's okay as long as options registered does not have name conflict
with existing options. Registeration of same option multiple times
does not create issue.

Change-Id: I18d3c8850c71aa8f991e88af5ce0859a3bec2d6d
Closes-Bug: #1518510
", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-12-02 17:35:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Assigning oslo config CONF once to parsed barbican CONF instance

The issue is around missing barbican configuration values when
its accessed via oslo_config.cfg.CONF handle which is the mechanism
used by few openstack common components.

To address this, assigning oslo_config.cfg.CONF instance to parsed
barbican.common.config.CONF handle at server startup only once.

commit_message:
Assigning oslo config CONF once to parsed barbican CONF instance

The issue is around missing barbican configuration values when
its accessed via oslo_config.cfg.CONF handle which is the mechanism
used by few openstack common components.

To address this, assigning oslo_config.cfg.CONF instance to parsed
barbican.common.config.CONF handle at server startup only once.
Currently barbican is creating separate conf instance at
its individual plugin module and uses that in their logic. cfg.CONF
instance is primarily used by openstack common components/libs so
there is no need to keep re-assigning cfg.CONF instance at every
plugin module usage.

Change-Id: I18d3c8850c71aa8f991e88af5ce0859a3bec2d6d
Closes-Bug: #1518510

commit_message:
Un-pin the amphora-agent version

In the dependent patch we pinned the amphora-agent to pull the patch set
version so that scenario tests will pass.  This patch removes that pin.

Change-Id: I1421939423916fd9dd5dc6f754a87e316ec7c110

commit_message:
Replaces __builtin__ with six.moves.builtins

__builtin__ does not exist in Python 3. Replacing it with
six.moves.builtins will ensure compatibility with both Python 2.7
and Python 3.4.

Removes unit tests from tests-py3.txt blacklist.

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: I07b905df6b107ca45fd6d0e589f89bd5ac5f1830

commit_message:
Validate connection limit for LBaaS

Currently, LBaaS V1 vip's connection_limit and LBaaS V2 listeners'
connection_limit can be set to a value less than -1.

This patch add a validation for V1 vip's and V2 listeners'
connection_limit resource. Setting value less than -1 is not allowed.

Closes-Bug: #1520138
Change-Id: I9332cfeda89b87dfda9cd16dcc8b1d78b6e1dc41

[{'created': '2015-09-01 12:21:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'lbaasv2: validate tenant-id is non-empty in api

Lbaasv2 is not validating if the tenant-id passed in api is non-empty.
Because of this, drivers behavior is not same for the api for empty tenant-id.
To avoid this, we will validate tenant-id is non-empty at plugin.

Closes-bug: #1451621

commit_message:
lbaasv2: validate tenant-id is non-empty in api

Lbaasv2 is not validating if the tenant-id passed in api is non-empty.
Because of this, drivers behavior is not same for the api for empty tenant-id.
To avoid this, we will validate tenant-id is non-empty at plugin.

Closes-bug: #1451621
Change-Id: I9d74a8bd9881dcff0e8d880624da9a48463aa31a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-02 15:07:30.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I36ec1829229081b6bc935ecc0d27836c8699a753
Closes-Bug: #1489059
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I36ec1829229081b6bc935ecc0d27836c8699a753
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Reboot if master node was reinstalled

If master node is reinstalled, the bootstraped node
has outdated MCollective config and as a result it
can not be used in any deployment, but is registered as
available in Fuel. This change fixes that by making
the agent monitor master node UID and reboot itself if
the UID has changed.

Change-Id: Iacb5eca57e339f973f676712766cb613a80f393e
Closes-Bug: #1431386

commit_message:
Add /api/master_node_uid endpoint

To fix the bug linked below we need an endpoint in Nailgun
which will help fuel-nailgun-agent detect if master node
was reinstalled. This CR adds endpoint exposing master node
UID which is unique for any Fuel installation. Now
fuel-nailgun-agent can monitor that endpoint and consider
master node to be reinstalled if the UID changes.

Related-Bug: #1431386
Change-Id: I519e52542b089b13ef287256c172ababb7a362ba

subject: Add simple CORS middleware gabbi tests
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 16:14:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add simple CORS middleware gabbi tests

A small example of how to test the CORS implementation with gabbi.

To get this to work the gabbi ConfigFixture needs to set a custom
api_paste_config to gabbi_paste.ini and called load_app instead of
setup_app to start the WSGI application. This causes the
oslo_middleware.cors middleware to be loaded, but not the
keystonemiddleware (which we do not want for these tests).

Unfortunately there's no convenient hook to load the app with a
custom set of middleware without a custom config file. Furthermore
it is challenging to override the config read by the oslo_middleware
from code instead of config. Thus we have the custom config file.

Change-Id: Id44564011f3b3fc7ed802836d61fc487dcdb60c8

commit_message:
Add simple CORS middleware gabbi tests

A small example of how to test the CORS implementation with gabbi.

To get this to work the gabbi ConfigFixture needs to set a custom
api_paste_config to gabbi_paste.ini and call load_app instead of
setup_app to start the WSGI application. This causes the
oslo_middleware.cors middleware to be loaded, but not the
keystonemiddleware (which we do not want for these tests).

Unfortunately there's no convenient hook to load the app with a
custom set of middleware without a custom config file. Furthermore
it is challenging to override the config read by the oslo_middleware
from code instead of config. Thus we have the custom config file.

Change-Id: Id44564011f3b3fc7ed802836d61fc487dcdb60c8

commit_message:
[sahara] gate-grenade-dsvm-sahara to merge check

gate-grenade-dsvm-sahara was moved to voting checks
in Ib886951eb6a773f429e51e4fc1ff9fca046c508e, but this job
is not presented on merge checks. This change does this job.

docs: ensure third party tests pass before +2

Adds a note to the code review guidelines to make sure appropriate third
party tests are passing before giving a change a +2 vote.

To avoid having extra L3HARouterAgentPortBinding with l3_agent as None,
operation of setting l3_agent should be atomic.
For this purpose, transaction was added in methods
create_ha_port_and_bind and _bind_ha_router_to_agents in change
Iaad82fe522cfd70061daecf411c924fdc11b7e41

In case if router was just created and l3 agent was not scheduled yet,
so l3_agent_id is None, l3-agent-list-hosting-router <router> will fail.

Partial-bug: #1499647

Change-Id: I1aaf4b651f738febc26b0e1105aeabe066bca2a0
(cherry picked from commit 0b8f9d0948cdb429c4b67ba138640ae515ffa1b2)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Skip bindings with agent_id=None

To avoid having extra L3HARouterAgentPortBinding with l3_agent as None,
operation of setting l3_agent should be atomic.
For this purpose, transaction was added in methods
create_ha_port_and_bind and _bind_ha_router_to_agents in change
Iaad82fe522cfd70061daecf411c924fdc11b7e41

In case if router was just created and l3 agent was not scheduled yet,
so l3_agent_id is None, l3-agent-list-hosting-router <router> will fail.
This change makes it work by skipping binding with agent_id=None.

Partial-bug: #1499647

Change-Id: I1aaf4b651f738febc26b0e1105aeabe066bca2a0
(cherry picked from commit 0b8f9d0948cdb429c4b67ba138640ae515ffa1b2)

commit_message:
Correct unwatch_log to support python <= 2.7.5

Currently unwatch_log[1] uses WatchedFileHandler.delay attribute to
build a FileHandler instance from a WatchedFileHandler instance but
this attribute doesn't exist before 2.7.6.

This change removes WatchedFileHandler.delay usage and uses default
FileHandler delay (it also ensures we open immediately the log file).

[1] neutron.agent.linux.daemon

Closes-Bug: #1520271
Change-Id: I70a156c4aeeda8a3adcc1036d670732c21ffa335
(cherry picked from commit eadd68f1774e4b9c0b11d361d52f761e4588a244)

commit_message:
Remove HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge usage in test

check_img_metadata_properties_quota raises HTTPBadRequest,
it will not raise HTTPRequestEntityTooLarge
Also, updated some comments for metadata validation to
remove confusion for v2/v2.1 difference.

Change-Id: Id4fcb1c2e56d45a05d043b5fa8fe5f3e38a9d230

commit_message:
Provide detailed information on architecture

Added new global architecture diagram using Dia tool
and a more detailed description of each component.
Exported this diagram in SVG format.
The source code of the diagram is stored in
/doc/images_src/ folder.
Moved also the architecture.rst file from the /dev
folder to the root folder of the Watcher doc.

Change-Id: I74379390178673dcb6a043967b31e38ca9560bb3

subject: Change the client imports to stop shadowing
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-04 14:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Change the client imports to stop shadowing

Because sometimes the easter bunny wants to kill you, we have been
importing the client library contructor modules with a name that is
identical to the proprety we set on the class to provide the client
object. That is bad practice in any circumstance.

Since we only use those things in one and only one place, don't bother
coming up with a better alias for them - just import the module path
itself directly. Explcit good.

Change-Id: Ib0d7e616df1304277b4b9936a64793bcba8787e3
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change the client imports to stop shadowing

Because sometimes the easter bunny wants to kill you, we have been
importing the client library contructor modules with a name that is
identical to the proprety we set on the class to provide the client
object. That is bad practice in any circumstance.

Since we only use those things in one and only one place, don't bother
coming up with a better alias for them - just import the module path
itself directly. Explcit good.

Change-Id: Ib0d7e616df1304277b4b9936a64793bcba8787e3

subject: Put py34 first in the env order of tox
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 04:10:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env, then, run py27.  This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I31857b82f30b495a77d77a9df70ee31487a906b7
Closes-Bug: #1489059
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env, then, run py27.  This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I31857b82f30b495a77d77a9df70ee31487a906b7
Closes-Bug: #1489059

subject: Cache the ImageManagementService object
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-26 01:08:33.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_vhdutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_vhdutilsv2.py', 'hyperv/nova/vhdutilsv2.py', 'hyperv/nova/vhdutils.py'], 'message': 'Cache the ImageManagementService object

The mentioned object is being queried every time an operation
is performed on a VHD/VHDX. Caching the object will result in
a better performance.

Change-Id: I4e50f1b31dfa2c72188132b23ec3d5577b8a0305
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cache the ImageManagementService object

The mentioned object is being queried every time an operation
is performed on a VHD/VHDX. Caching the object will result in
a better performance.

Change-Id: I4e50f1b31dfa2c72188132b23ec3d5577b8a0305

commit_message:
Cleanup orphaned code from ceph backup driver

The method _num_backup_snaps was not being called anywhere in the source.
This removes the unused call from the driver.

Change-Id: Ib094edff6c26a21177405a988f132c3c6c8c9646

commit_message:
Update requirements to stable/liberty

Update requirements in requirements.txt file.

Require the following modules only if python2.6:
* argparse
* ordereddict

Is NOT compatible with CentOS6 master node.

Use new oslo import notation.

Change-Id: Ib6a5be6ad784339ba4ee2f69a94a400ab8d79dfe
Blueprint: master-on-centos7

commit_message:
Adjusting commonly failing tasks

This patch takes two commonly failing tasks and configures them to be fixed
if a variable is toggled on. This is needed for gate checks to pass for
ansible-functional runs.

Closes-bug: 1521233

Change-Id: I4f54ef7af30d530f781d60ce232cc6aacda81ce4

commit_message:
db: prepare scripts for subproject db tables

This patch prepares related files for introducing independent sub project
tables. This is preparation for networking-odl overhaul which will
introduce new db tables.

Change-Id: I4af931f5c3acf2e12081879669f9420426d074bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-01 14:53:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Initial support for installation of ironic-inspector

This review adds the ironic-inspector as a component that can be
opted to be installed by the user.  Note, this is moderately useless
without shade support and modules to assist the users to leverage
this workflow.

If a user wishes to utilize at this time before those items exist
then they will have to move nodes in available state back to
manageable state, and then invoke the inspect state which will
return them to manageable state once done.

Change-Id: I7b4ff92fa27578a9a7b0f25fc6e8658c3f2700aa
implements: blueprint bifrost-inspector-support
Depends-On: I27caa1122a72ac655958b7a6aa14b7566964f998

commit_message:
Initial support for installation of ironic-inspector

This review adds the ironic-inspector as a component that can be
opted to be installed by the user.  Note, this is moderately useless
without shade support and modules to assist the users to leverage
this workflow.

If a user wishes to utilize at this time before those items exist
then they will have to move nodes in available state back to
manageable state, and then invoke the inspect state which will
return them to manageable state once done.

Change-Id: I7b4ff92fa27578a9a7b0f25fc6e8658c3f2700aa
implements: blueprint bifrost-inspector-support
Depends-On: I27caa1122a72ac655958b7a6aa14b7566964f998

subject: Raise an exception for identical associations
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 13:23:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow identical network associations

When a request asks for creating a network association that
already exists, we catch the DB exception and answer with the
association parameters that already exists in the DB.

Change-Id: Iafcaa6b016bc5f39f5ee1d64ef7ff627efa74183
Closes-Bug: 1512714
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-04 13:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/db/bgpvpn_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/db/test_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/extensions/bgpvpn.py'], 'message': 'Raise an exception for identical associations

When a request asks for creating a network association that
already exists, we have to catch the DB exception and raise an
exception that respond an error code 400.

Change-Id: Iafcaa6b016bc5f39f5ee1d64ef7ff627efa74183
Closes-Bug: 1512714
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Raise an exception for identical associations

When a request asks for creating a network association that
already exists, we have to catch the DB exception and raise an
exception that respond an error code 400.

Change-Id: Iafcaa6b016bc5f39f5ee1d64ef7ff627efa74183
Closes-Bug: 1512714

commit_message:
Update configuration section for rabbitmq

Change ID Ie027df023e6133f3188e57b42846083f28c282bd integrated the oslo_messaging_rabbit configuration into Watcher. This commit is an update
of the Watcher configuration documentation section, to take into account
new parameters for messaging RabbitMQ broker.

Change-Id: I9aa60c7dd264b4e8535e41ae2f98083985b87b0f

commit_message:
Created a glossary to lay down Watcher terminology

As of now, we do not have a single source of truth
when it comes to the terminology describing the various components
Watcher is made of. Hence, this is an attempt to formalize it into
a single document.

Change-Id: Iffbbe9148e53c88e38297fa9e81b8b024cce4099

commit_message:
Add Workload object

The patch introduces Workload model
instead of regular dict that was used to describe
scenario configuration in TaskEngine.
As a side effect it allows to fix subtask representaion
in generated reports and other rally outputs.

Change-Id: I62148707c89f575f83da11e34d0d193e716e8249

Change-Id: I0cc290e9fc13c8d61d933fe4b457008df0a29c5a
Closes-Bug: #1489059
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I0cc290e9fc13c8d61d933fe4b457008df0a29c5a
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could not be determined" on py34 we
have to run first the py34 env to, then, run py27. This patch puts py34
first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this problem to happen.

Change-Id: I6616835bc5e13b07f79be584c4306e2573a002d8
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Update OS::Magnum::BayModel to not require network_driver

Updating this resource with changes in Magnum to allow
not specifying the network_driver.
When no network-driver is selected for baymodel create for a
given COE, Magnum should choose the default network driver for that
COE.

Change-Id: I163ba441211f41eaf9fd49b5a9adbda62e1f33ea
Related-Bug: 1501077
Depends-On: I0735f79354bc9fdb141e7a559517268e8ab648ec

commit_message:
[config-ref] Consolidate GlusterFS docu

* Follow doc conventions for wording and formatting.
* Remove optional parameter, they are all documented in the autogenerated
  table.
* Remove duplicated content.
* Remove notes about Liberty.

commit_message:
Adding a new vnic_type for Ironic/Neutron/Nova integration

A new vnic type is added to specify baremetal ports/nics.
This fix is needed to ensure that the handshake between
Neutron and Nova works fine to accomodate Ironic setting
vnic_type to baremetal

Change-Id: I5d89da1fe4c7fe463947c32364131c4a4778f13d
Implements: blueprint ironic-networks-support

commit_message:
devref:Don't suggest decorate private method

per https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164229
suggested on the spec, we should not suggest private method
decoration on microversion, so this update the doc to sync it

Change-Id: Ie937173a4d1542eb1c551795ca371ebce69c7078

OpenStack typo

Change Openstack to OpenStack as per
standard and
change "stackforge/ec2-api to
openstack/ec2-api" because ec2-api had
moved to openstack

commit_message:
Do not erase some packages on cleaning fuel-centos-image

We shouldn't erase packages, since we have dependencies for
them in our containers (for example httpd, cobbler, nginx, etc)

Change-Id: Ia9a1b5ba64907f5b0ec10c7ca9b14f2d4879cfdf
Closes-bug: #1509710

commit_message:
Do not expose exceptions from requests library

Novaclient expects the requests library to always be able to get a
response back and doesn't handle other cases where it might raise
an exception even before the request is completed (e.g.
ConnectionError).

These exceptions should be captured and properly converted to some
native novaclient exception.

This was originally proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/235558/
without inheriting exceptions from the requests library.  That broke the
cinder gate, which relied on the old behavior, so it was reverted in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/239941/.

In this patch, the new exceptions inherit from the requests exceptions
to ease the downstream projects' transition to expecting novaclient
exceptions instead of requests exceptions.

Change-Id: I40a6283a42a565f812a6115e382f852ad784aa92
Co-Authored-By: Kuo-tung Kao <jelly.k@inwinstack.com>
Closes-Bug: #1406586

commit_message:
Do not mount /etc/yum.repos.d into containers

Content of /etc/yum.repos.d deleted during each container
startup procedure, which doesn't look reasonable, because if
this directory is mounted to every container all that we do
is just removing it's content several times.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Is NOT compatible with CentOS6 master node

Change-Id: Ib668234224685d88fc34db9071f2eb87ae50f008

commit_message:
Use LVM volume group as backend for docker

In order to improve docker container performance LVM volume
group can be used as a backend for docker containers.

Requires: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/247691

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Is NOT compatible with CentOS6 master node

Related-Bug: #1333458

Change-Id: If66f5abf5e35e3cbb5cc1f0092104eea80c2ea80

commit_message:
Systemd units for docker containers

Make every docker container a standard systemd unit, allowing
it to be managed by standard way with systemctl.

Also add systemd support to dockercrl.

Blueprint: master-on-centos7

Breaks: nothing

Change-Id: I924534b43d083f93130d2af805609a81b302d7de

subject: Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-03 13:26:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sequence of length-2 sequences, these are benefits copied
from [1]:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.
Magnum does not support python 2.6, we can leverage this.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].
Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwagrs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/480757/

Change-Id: I61992fa428d6760449afe3754b02506336e8b421

commit_message:
Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sequence of length-2 sequences, these are benefits copied
from [1]:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.
Magnum does not support python 2.6, we can leverage this.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].
Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwagrs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using
-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/480757/

Change-Id: I61992fa428d6760449afe3754b02506336e8b421

commit_message:
Swarm: Add swarm master HA support

Add --replication and --advertise to swarm master to support swarm HA.
After this patch, user can start more than 1 swarm master.

Refer docs: https://docs.docker.com/swarm/multi-manager-setup/

Partially implements: blueprint swarm-high-availability
Change-Id: I3b6c1ad64598541d055178a54f1507af6882c736

commit_message:
Move API module 'share_instances' under v2 dir

Share instances API has min version as 2.3 and considered as v2-only.
But now it is stored under v1 dir for no reason.
Move it to proper dir and remove from v1 router because it could not
be used using v1 API anyway.

Change-Id: I1e3c306b31235cd422ac339df56147439a7bbace
Closes-Bug: #1521999

commit_message:
fix error in alembic when upgrade postgresql

ALTER TYPE ... ADD cannot run inside a transaction block,
therefore we use another way to update it.

Change-Id: I8c6f62b7642917a2ea1bc0280e41261797aca172
Closes-Bug: #1520777

commit_message:
fix pecan _lookup usage

_lookup routing in pecan is expected to be an object method. we
incorrectly set it to static which throws a few warnings. this patch
fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1521283
Change-Id: I0911cbe830eef84af613e08dc9495109d27a1646

subject: fix expunge_metrics method
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-30 21:38:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "fix expunge_metrics method

expunge_metrics method does not work properly. it uses list_metrics
from indexer to get metrics with status == 'delete'. this makes sense
but list_metrics itself is hardcoded to always search for 'active'
status. because of that, the query will always be look for status ==
'active' and status == 'delete' which can't happen so it never finds
any match.

Change-Id: I318fa5b4642a187776dce23ee9a933a5f852c4f8
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-12-01 19:43:50.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/test_indexer.py', 'gnocchi/indexer/sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': "fix expunge_metrics method

expunge_metrics method does not work properly. it uses list_metrics
from indexer to get metrics with status == 'delete'. this makes sense
but list_metrics itself is hardcoded to always search for 'active'
status. because of that, the query will always be look for status ==
'active' and status == 'delete' which can't happen so it never finds
any match.

Change-Id: I318fa5b4642a187776dce23ee9a933a5f852c4f8
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
fix expunge_metrics method

expunge_metrics method does not work properly. it uses list_metrics
from indexer to get metrics with status == 'delete'. this makes sense
but list_metrics itself is hardcoded to always search for 'active'
status. because of that, the query will always be look for status ==
'active' and status == 'delete' which can't happen so it never finds
any match.
